title.narrative: NUTRITION SYSTEMS

description.narrative: By 2020, evidence based national nutrition related policies, legislation, strategies, and plans are adopted and implementation monitored, which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Micronutrients, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition In Early Childhood (Covid), Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Nutrition â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome: By 2020, Children in the first 1,000 days in high burden provinces have improved nutritional status

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, evidence based national nutrition related policies, legislation, strategies, and plans are adopted and implementationmonitored

description.narrative: Key evidence was generated in 2021 with UNICEF support, especially related to stunting, with IOF results indicating a decrease from 43 to 38 per cent. In the context of accelerating salt iodization, UNICEF supported repair works at two provincial laboratories for quality assurance of iodised salt, continuity in the process of creating the national association of salt producers, and dissemination of information to increase the consumption of iodized salt. | Status:Met | As-of Date:02/02/2022
